oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of the Old Hickory Gunpowder plant water intake
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Water intake for the Old Hickory plant on the Cumberland River. Panoramic photograph shows large wooden structures; the tall one at right has windows and an observation deck. A wooden shack sits at left. On the right can be seen the low Cumberland River. The Old Hickory DuPont Gunpowder plant manufactured smokeless gunpowder for the Allies during the Great War. At the time, it was the largest gunpowder factory in the world. Thousands of domestic and foreign workers lived in the company town.
